{include "default_salutation"} –

Public safety should mean serving people, but police often criminalize, harm, and kill people – especially in Black and Brown communities. Each of us can be an agent of change, and we want to work together to redefine public safety and reimagine the role of police in our society.

To that end, we just launched ReimaginePublicSafetyVA.org – a hub for learning, action, and building community around the issue of police violence and Virginia's over-reliance on the criminal legal system. In this hub, you can:

  • Share your story of police violence and connect with other activists.
  • Learn some ways you can help end police violence, stop the over-policing of Black and Brown communities, and divert resources away from police and into communities.
  • Take action, like emailing your lawmakers, getting involved with your local civilian review board, and talking to your friends and family.

State lawmakers will reconvene in January, and we're pushing a bold agenda to reimagine public safety. Read an overview of this agenda and why we believe it's so important on our website.

We're asking you to share our new hub with your networks and be a part of the movement to build safer, healthier communities – free from police violence.

Thanks for sticking with us,
